member.name: T:Tesseract.Interop.ITessApiSignatures
member.summary: The exported tesseract api signatures.
member.remarks: Please note this is only public for technical reasons (you can't proxy a internal interface). It should be considered an internal interface and is NOT part of the public api and may have breaking changes between releases.

member.summary: Creates a new BaseAPI instance

member.name: M:Tesseract.Interop.ILeptonicaApiSignatures.pixcmapCreate(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new colormap with the specified .
member.param: The depth of the pix in bpp, can be 2, 4, or 8
member.returns: The pointer to the color map, or null on error.

member.name: M:Tesseract.Interop.ILeptonicaApiSignatures.pixcmapCreateRandom(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new colormap of the specified with random colors where the first color can optionally be set to black, and the last optionally set to white.
member.param: The depth of the pix in bpp, can be 2, 4, or 8
If set to 1 the first color will be black.
If set to 1 the last color will be white.
member.returns: The pointer to the color map, or null on error.

member.name: M:Tesseract.Interop.ILeptonicaApiSignatures.pixcmapCreateLinear(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new colormap of the specified with equally spaced gray color values.
member.param: The depth of the pix in bpp, can be 2, 4, or 8
The number of levels (must be between 2 and 2^
member.returns: The pointer to the colormap, or null on error.

member.name: M:Tesseract.Interop.ILeptonicaApiSignatures.pixcmapDestroy(System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: Destorys and cleans up any memory used by the color map.
member.param: The pointer to the colormap instance, set to null on success.

member.name: M:Tesseract.Interop.ILeptonicaApiSignatures.pixcmapGetCount(System.Runtime.InteropServices.HandleRef)
member.summary: Gets the number of color entries in the color map.
member.param: The pointer to the colormap instance.
member.returns: Returns the number of color entries in the color map, or 0 on error.

member.name: M:Tesseract.Interop.ILeptonicaApiSignatures.pixcmapGetFreeCount(System.Runtime.InteropServices.HandleRef)
member.summary: Gets the number of free color entries in the color map.
member.param: The pointer to the colormap instance.
member.returns: Returns the number of free color entries in the color map, or 0 on error.

member.name: M:Tesseract.Interop.ILeptonicaApiSignatures.pixcmapGetDepth(System.Runtime.InteropServices.HandleRef)
member.returns: Returns color maps depth, or 0 on error.

member.summary: Removes all colors from the color map by setting the count to zero.
member.param: The pointer to the colormap instance.

member.name: M:Tesseract.Interop.ILeptonicaApiSignatures.pixcmapAddColor(System.Runtime.InteropServices.HandleRef,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds the color to the pix color map if their is room.

member.name: M:Tesseract.Interop.ILeptonicaApiSignatures.pixcmapAddNewColor(System.Runtime.InteropServices.HandleRef,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Adds the specified color if it doesn't already exist, returning the colors index in the data array.
member.param: The pointer to the colormap instance.
The red value
The green value
The blue value
The index of the new color if it was added, or the existing color if it already existed.
member.returns: Returns 0 for success, 1 for error, 2 for not enough space.

member.name: M:Tesseract.Interop.ILeptonicaApiSignatures.pixcmapAddNearestColor(System.Runtime.InteropServices.HandleRef,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Adds the specified color if it doesn't already exist, returning the color's index in the data array.
member.remarks: If the color doesn't exist and there is not enough room to add a new color return the nearest color.
member.param: The pointer to the colormap instance.
The red value
The green value
The blue value
The index of the new color if it was added, or the existing color if it already existed.
member.returns: Returns 0 for success, 1 for error, 2 for not enough space.

member.summary: Checks if the color already exists or if their is enough room to add it.
member.param: The pointer to the colormap instance.
The red value
The green value
The blue value
Returns 1 if usable; 0 if not.

member.name: M:Tesseract.Interop.ILeptonicaApiSignatures.pixcmapAddBlackOrWhite(System.Runtime.InteropServices.HandleRef,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Adds a color (black\white) if not already there returning it's index through .
member.param: The pointer to the colormap instance.
The color to add (0 for black; 1 for white)
The index of the color.

member.name: M:Tesseract.Interop.ILeptonicaApiSignatures.pixcmapSetBlackAndWhite(System.Runtime.InteropServices.HandleRef,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the darkest color in the colormap to black, if is 1. Sets the lightest color in the colormap to white if is 1.
member.param: The pointer to the colormap instance.
0 for no operation; 1 to set darket color to black
0 for no operation; 1 to set lightest color to white

member.name: M:Tesseract.Interop.ILeptonicaApiSignatures.pixcmapGetColor32(System.Runtime.InteropServices.HandleRef,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Gets the color at the specified index.
member.remarks: The alpha channel will always be zero as it is not used in Leptonica color maps.
member.param: The pointer to the colormap instance.
The index of the color entry.
The color entry as 32 bit value
member.returns: Returns 0 if OK; 1 if not accessable (caller should check).

member.name: M:Tesseract.Interop.ILeptonicaApiSignatures.pixcmapResetColor(System.Runtime.InteropServices.HandleRef,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets a previously allocated color entry.
member.param: The pointer to the colormap instance.
The index of the colormap entry
member.returns: Returns 0 if OK; 1 if not accessable (caller should check).

member.name: T:Tesseract.PageSegMode
member.summary: Represents the possible page layou analysis modes.

member.name: F:Tesseract.PageSegMode.OsdOnly
member.summary: Orientation and script detection (OSD) only.

member.name: F:Tesseract.PageSegMode.AutoOsd
member.summary: Automatic page sementation with orientantion and script detection (OSD).

member.name: F:Tesseract.PageSegMode.AutoOnly
member.summary: Automatic page segmentation, but no OSD, or OCR.

member.name: F:Tesseract.PageSegMode.Auto
member.summary: Fully automatic page segmentation, but no OSD.

member.name: F:Tesseract.PageSegMode.SingleColumn
member.summary: Assume a single column of text of variable sizes.

member.name: F:Tesseract.PageSegMode.SingleBlockVertText
member.summary: Assume a single uniform block of vertically aligned text.

member.name: F:Tesseract.PageSegMode.SingleBlock
member.summary: Assume a single uniform block of text.

member.name: F:Tesseract.PageSegMode.SingleLine
member.summary: Treat the image as a single text line.

member.name: F:Tesseract.PageSegMode.SingleWord
member.summary: Treat the image as a single word.

member.name: F:Tesseract.PageSegMode.CircleWord
member.summary: Treat the image as a single word in a circle.

member.name: F:Tesseract.PageSegMode.SingleChar
member.summary: Treat the image as a single character.

member.name: F:Tesseract.PageSegMode.SparseText
member.summary: Find as much text as possible in no particular order.

member.name: F:Tesseract.PageSegMode.SparseTextOsd
member.summary: Sparse text with orientation and script detection.

member.name: F:Tesseract.PageSegMode.RawLine
member.summary: Treat the image as a single text line, bypassing hacks that are Tesseract-specific.

member.name: F:Tesseract.PageSegMode.Count
member.summary: Number of enum entries.

member.name: M:Tesseract.Pix.#ctor(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Creates a new pix instance using an existing handle to a pix structure.
member.remarks: Note that the resulting instance takes ownership of the data structure.

member.name: M:Tesseract.Pix.Save(System.String,System.Nullable{Tesseract.ImageFormat})
member.summary: Saves the image to the specified file.
member.param: The path to the file.
The format to use when saving the image, if not specified the file extension is used to guess the format.

member.name: M:Tesseract.Pix.Clone
member.summary: Increments this pix's reference count and returns a reference to the same pix data.
member.remarks:
A "clone" is simply a reference to an existing pix. It is implemented this way because image can be large and hence expensive to copy and extra handles need to be made with a simple policy to avoid double frees and memory leaks.
The general usage protocol is:
Whenever you want a new reference to an existing call .
Always call on all references. This decrements the reference count and will destroy the pix when the reference count reaches zero.
member.returns: The pix with it's reference count incremented.

member.name: T:Tesseract.PixColormap
member.summary: Represents a colormap.
member.remarks: Once the colormap is assigned to a pix it is owned by that pix and will be disposed off automatically when the pix is disposed off.

member.name: M:Tesseract.PixData.EndianByteSwap
member.summary: Swaps the bytes on little-endian platforms within a word; bytes 0 and 3 swapped, and bytes `1 and 2 are swapped.
member.remarks: This is required for little-endians in situations where we convert from a serialized byte order that is in raster order, as one typically has in file formats, to one with MSB-to-the-left in each 32-bit word, or v.v. See

member.name: T:Tesseract.TesseractEngine
member.summary: The tesseract OCR engine.

member.name: M:Tesseract.TesseractEngine.#ctor(System.String,System.String,Tesseract.EngineMode)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of with the specified .

remarks.para: The parameter should point to the directory that contains the 'tessdata' folder for example if your tesseract language data is installed in C:\Tesseract\tessdata the value of datapath should be C:\Tesseract. Note that tesseract will use the value of the TESSDATA_PREFIX environment variable if defined, effectively ignoring the value of parameter.

member.param: The path to the parent directory that contains the 'tessdata' directory, ignored if the TESSDATA_PREFIX environment variable is defined.
The language to load, for example 'eng' for English.
The value to use when initialising the tesseract engine.

member.name: M:Tesseract.TesseractEngine.#ctor(System.String,System.String,Tesseract.EngineMode,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of with the specified and .

remarks.para: The parameter should point to the directory that contains the 'tessdata' folder for example if your tesseract language data is installed in C:\Tesseract\tessdata the value of datapath should be C:\Tesseract. Note that tesseract will use the value of the TESSDATA_PREFIX environment variable if defined, effectively ignoring the value of parameter.

member.param: The path to the parent directory that contains the 'tessdata' directory, ignored if the TESSDATA_PREFIX environment variable is defined.
The language to load, for example 'eng' for English.
The value to use when initialising the tesseract engine.

An optional sequence of tesseract configuration files to load, encoded using UTF8 without BOM with Unix end of line characters you can use an advanced text editor such as Notepad++ to accomplish this.
